import React from 'react' import { Helmet } from 'react-helmet' import Navbar from '../components/navbar' import Footer from '../components/footer' import './portfolioproject3.css' const Portfolioproject3 = (props) => { return (
exported project
Unity Virtual Production
Virtual production is a rapidly growing field in the film and television industry. It combines the flexibility and real time power of contemporary game engines with the look and render of a film. Unity for Virtual Production is dedicated to improving workflows for film, television, real-time virtual events, mixed media, and performance capture.

My Responsibilities
project objectives and user pain points user interviews Overseeing the development integrate feedback and refine design concepts For over 2 years, I worked on multiple projects to empower Unitys virtual production sector. Working on the Vprod required an understanding of filmmaking procedures, visual effects, pre and post production, industry-standard software and hardware. My role involved deeply understanding the user's needs and the technical landscape to create intuitive and impactful solutions.



Defining to guide the design direction.

Conducting {' '} to gather insights and inform design decisions.

{' '} of user interfaces and flows, ensuring a seamless and effective user experience.

Collaborating with cross-functional teams to .

Streamlining the deployment and improving efficiency and user satisfaction.
Projects
Blackmagic Video Decklink Card Support
The Unity Blackmagic package supports video capture cards from Blackmagic Design to input and output pro-grade video and audio in the Unity Editor and runtime builds, rendering composited video feeds in the Editor and output via SDI.



I supported the team in developing an intuitive interface for connecting, controlling, and monitoring BMD cards and video feeds in Unity. This allows users to simultaneously manage inputs and outputs and synchronize the timecode across all sources.

View Case Study
Green Screen Keyer
Chroma key composition or green screen blends two images or video streams based on color hues, primarily to remove backgrounds from subjects in photos or videos. Unitys keyer package offers real-time green screen composition with detailed controls and a garbage mask feature.



I led the design of the feature, crafting the user interface and experience from the ground up. My focus was on creating an efficient and effective tool that met the project's unique needs of empowering users to key film quality visuals in the game engine.

OSC (Open Sound Control)
Open Sound Control (OSC) is a protocol designed for networking sound synthesizers. It provides a flexible and open framework for communication among devices, allowing for high-resolution, low-latency, and inter-application messaging.



I crafted the OSC package for Unity. My approach was to streamline the communication process between Unity and various multimedia devices, ensuring a robust and user-friendly interface that empowers creators to synchronize and control their OSC components.

Cluster Display (Cluster Rendering)
Unitys Cluster Rendering technology allows multiple machines to simulate the same scene in-sync with each other, and display the result on a cluster of displays. This feature enables the users to deploy Unity environment to multi-screen environment like a video wall.



There are 3 fundamental building blocks for the cluster rendering. I managed the comprehensive design of the interface and user flow: the internal Unity package for multi-machine live editing, the web application for deploying and monitoring the cluster system, and enhancements to third-party clustering solutions.
Live Editing
Live Editing enables the generation and control of all monitors (render-nodes) to display virtual set imagery in real time.



I designed the UX for Unitys Live Editing, where a master node orchestrates and synchronizes all client nodes. This essential feature is made up of a minimalistic interface, allowing Vset operators to efficiently deploy their Unity scenes across the network.

Mission Control
Mission Control is the user-centric system designed to launch the clustered contents synchronously across multiple computers and displays.



I crafted the web-based interface for Mission Control, adhering to Unity's Dashboard design system. My role encompassed managing core functions of the panel, such as configuring setups, initiating systems, controlling synchronization, and monitoring status.

Unity x Disguise RenderStream
RenderStream is the proprietary protocol by Disguise for controlling Unity scenes. Unity projects can be configured to generate RenderStream output streams using Disguises Unity plugin.



Redesigned the cumbersome manual and multi-step process for adding the RenderStream plugin and configuring scene objects. Now, a new dedicated window enables users to swiftly select and configure in-scene objects for control in Disguise.
